title.narrative: Haiti - Education for All Project - Phase II

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to support: (i) enrollment of students in select non-public primary schools in disadvantagedareas;(ii) student attendance in select public and non-public primary schools in disadvantaged areas; and (iii) strengthened management of the Recipient's primary education sector.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I. A. 5 | Description :The Recipient shall, no later than three months after the beginning ofeach school year during Project implementation, disclose thelist of schools, number of students covered and grade level of studentsbenefiting from the Universal, Free and Compulsory Primary Education Program (“PSUGO - Programme de Scolarisation Universelle,Gratuite et Obligatoire”). | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I.A.1(b) (ii) | Description :No later than September 30, 2014, establish and thereafteroperate and maintain throughout Project implementation, a committee (theNational Strategic Committee) with a structure andfunctions and responsibilities acceptable to the Association, as set forth in detail in the Operational Manual. | Due Date:30-Sep-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2Section I.A.3 | Description :By no later than October 30, 2014, the Recipient through MENFP, shallappoint, and thereafter maintain, where applicable, throughout the duration of the Project implementation, independent verificationagencies, with qualifications, experience, and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association, for purposes of the third-partyverification of the Subprojects to be carried out under the Project | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2Section I.C.3 | Description :No transfer of Financing funds shall be made to any SMC or BeneficiaryService Provider, as the case may be prior to the date on which the pertinent SMC or Beneficiary Service Provider has entered intothe pertinent Grant Agreement. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2Section I.F. 1 | Description :1. The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is carried out inaccordance with the ESMF and RPF. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2Section I.F. 2 | Description :2. The Recipient shall include in the Project Reports referred to inSection II.A of this Schedule, adequate information on the implementation of the ESMF and the RPF, any EMP, RAP or similarsafeguard instrument. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2Section I.F. 3 | Description :3. The Recipient, through MENFP, shall ensure that any works to becarried out under the Project do not affect Natural Habitats, Forests or Physical Cultural Resources. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2Section I.F.7 | Description :The Recipient shall carry out the RRAP in accordance with its terms andin a manner satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Cumulative children participating in integrated nutrition/health program (cumulative)
Activties to support MENFP actors' technical and administrative capacity are provided

baseline.value: EPT I capacity strengthening activities carried out

target.value: Training and technical assistance provided on data collection to enable MENFP staff to implement and oversee the quality assurancesystem

actual.value: Training and technical assistance provided on data collection to enable MENFP staff to implement and oversee the Quality AssuranceSystem tools.

title.narrative: Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Number of additional qualified primary teachers resulting from project interventions.
Percentage of schools inspected at least once per year by the MENFP (non-cumulative)
Textbooks per pupil in tuition waiver schools (non-cumulative)
Children participating in integrated nutrition/health program (annual, non-cumulative)
Number of children enrolled in tuition waiver schools (annual, non-cumulative)
Enrollment of students in select non-public primary schools in disadvantaged areas: Number of tuition waivers financed in non-public schools
Percentage of school feeding project beneficiary schools contacted at least twice per year through a beneficiary feedback mechanismto collect actionable feedback.

baseline.value: Beneficiary feedback mechanism not in place.

target.value: 90% of school feeding program beneficiary schools contacted at least twice during the SY to collect feedback.

title.narrative: Students benefitting from improved reading instruction approach (M'ap Li Net Ale) (non-cumulative)
Cumulative Students benefiting from improved reading instruction approach (M ap Li Net Ale)
Targeted supervision approach of the Tuition Waiver Program based on school needs is implemented
Percentage of Tuition Waiver Program (TWP) schools publicly posting annual expenditure reports (non-cumulative)

baseline.value: Diagnostic sector study not designed and student mentoring pilot not developed

title.narrative: Student attendance in select public and non-public primary schools in disadvantaged areas: Attendance rate is at least maintained in schools benefiting from the school health and nutrition program
MENFP uses data on registered public and non-public primary schools to assess, categorize, and improve the quality of service delivery.

baseline.value: MENFP has registered all public and non-public primary schools requesting a school identity card(2014-2015)

target.value: School scorecards including action items for improvement are delivered to the 1% of primary schools assessed in previous years.

actual.value: School scorecards including action items for improvement are delivered to a representative sample of primary schools assessed inprevious year.

title.narrative: The school registration database is operational

target.value: MENFP school registration database is operational

actual.value: MENFP school registration database is operational

title.narrative: MENFP develops a multi-year sector operational plan

target.value: Sector operation plan drafted and under discussion by stakeholders

actual.value: Sector Operational Plan drafted and under discussion by stakeholders.

title.narrative: Cumulative number of children participating in post hurricane Matthew enhanced emergency integrated nutrition/health program
Number of school kits, student kits and teacher kits delivered to schools impacted by hurricane Matthew
Number of schools affected by hurricane Matthew rehabilitated or receiving a semi-permanent shelter at the primary level resulting from project intervention
